#Text=Fionnphort
#Text=Fionnphort is a small port at the far west of the Ross of Mull , where the ferry crosses to Iona .
#Text=It lacks accommodation - this can be found in Bunessan five miles east , so facilities there are also described on this page .
#Text=Get in
#Text=A849 runs west from Craignure which has a ferry from Oban on the mainland ; and Oban has buses and trains from Glasgow .
#Text=The road follows the shore of Loch Scridain to Bunessan ( 30 miles ) and Fionnphort ( another 5 miles ) .
#Text=Bus 96 / 496 meets the ferries at Craignure and runs four times M-Sat and once on Sunday to , taking 70 mins .
#Text=Here it connects with the ferry to Iona which sails roughly hourly 08:30 - 18:15 , but on demand in summer , taking 10 mins .
#Text=Adult single ferry fare is £1.75 , bikes are free , visitors ' cars are not permitted .
#Text=Fionnphort ferry terminal has toilets and a small waiting room and snack bar .
#Text=Buses and ferries are held to make these connections but in bad weather , Fionnphort is exposed to the Atlantic and ferries may be cancelled for days on end .
#Text=Ferry staff will advise non-residents against crossing to Iona if the forecast is bad .
#Text=There are two car parks in Fionnphort .
#Text=There 's a pay & display car park by the ferry pier ; current charges unknown but the Council are proposing £9 / day for summer 2019 .
#Text=A quarter mile further back in the village , turn into the lane south for the Columba Centre car park , free , but it 's small and fills up quickly in summer .
#Text=Get around
#Text=You 'll want your own wheels between Bunessan and Fionnphort , since the bus is infrequent .
#Text=See
#Text=Iona can easily be done as a day trip but deserves longer .
#Text=is a tiny village 2 miles north of Fionnphort .
#Text=It has a nice sheltered beach when the tide drops , suitable for children 's bathing , but at high tide the beach is completely covered .
#Text=Ardalanish Isle of Mull Weavers , Bunessan PA67 6DR , ☏ +441681700265 .
#Text=Apr-mid Oct daily 10:00 - 17:00 , mid Oct-mid Dec & mid Jan-March M - F 10:00-16:00. Farm , knitwear and gift shop , and you can tour the weaving mill .
#Text=Ross Of Mull Historical Centre ( Ionad Echdraidh an Rois Mhuilich ) , Millbrae Cottage , Bunessan PA67 6DG , ☏ +441681700659 .
#Text=Apr-Oct M - F 10:00-16:00. It 's really a local history archive and research centre rather than a museum .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Boat trips to on the island of Staffa , and the , may pick up from Fionnphort and Iona .
#Text=Do
#Text=The best beach is on the south coast at Ardalanish : follow lane from village .
#Text=Become a Monk or Nun .
#Text=There are two religious retreats here , not open for casual visits :
#Text=Bird watching both on land and on the boat trips .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Spar ( Convenience Store ) , Post Office Stores , Bunessan PA67 6DG , ☏ +441681700395 .
#Text=M - Sa 08:00 - 18:00 , Su 10:00-16:00. The only proper store in the Ross of Mull , and the last chance to stock up before crossing to Iona .
#Text=Good selection of food and other essentials , with off-license .
#Text=More expensive than the mainland but decent value for such a remote spot .
#Text=Also incorporates the local Post Office .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Ninth Wave , Bruach Mhor ( Half a mile east of Fionnphort , watch for sign , turn north into lane ) , ☏ +441681700757 .
#Text=May-Jun & mid-July-Oct W - Su 19:00-23:00. Seafood dinners , licensed , booking essential .
#Text=The Keel Row , ☏ +441681700458 .
#Text=Creel Seafood Bar , Fionnphort Pier , PA66 6BL , ☏ +441681700312 .
#Text=It 's a seafood takeaway in a cabin by the pier .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Argyll Arms has the only public bar .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=is 2 miles south of Fionnphort .
#Text=It 's open May-Sept , with basic pitches by the shore and portacabin showers & toilets , tel +44 1681 700427 .
#Text=Seaview Bed and Breakfast , ☏ +441681700235 .
#Text=Comfy friendly place close to the ferry pier .
#Text=They also let The Bothy for self-catering by the week .
#Text=B&B double from £100 .
#Text=Caol-Ithe does B&B and self-catering lets .
#Text=Catchean Caravans are static for self-catering let by the week , Sat - Sat ; they do n't have tourer pitches .
#Text=Staffa House , ☏ +441681700677 .
#Text=B&B with four bedrooms en suite .
#Text=B&B double £90 .
#Text=Ardachy House , Ardalanish , Bunessan PA67 6DS ( 1.5 miles south of Bunressan on Ardalanish Bay ) , ☏ +441681700505 , ✉ info@ardachy.co.uk .
#Text=Check-in : 16:00 , check-out : 10:00 .
#Text=New owners in 2019 but still in business , 3-star B&B in modern building .
#Text=B&B double £90 .
#Text=There 's also B&B at Newcrofts south of Fionnphort and Ardness House a couple of miles west .
#Text=Argyll Arms Hotel , Bunessan PA67 6DP , ☏ +441681700240 , ✉ argyllarmshotel@isleofmull.co.uk .
#Text=Hotel open Apr-Sept , restaurant and bar open all year daily .
#Text=B&B double from £80 .
#Text=Beach House Self Catering , Lower Ardtun , Bunessan , ☏ +44131 669-3082 .
#Text=Check-in : 16:00 , check-out : 11:00 .
#Text=Beach House is a restored farmhouse looking over Loch Scridain , half way between Bunessan and Pennyghael .
#Text=( The name is Gaelic be-ach , bees , not beach which would be traigh . )
#Text=The holiday home sleeps 8 , let Sunday to Sunday .
#Text=No availability however during 2019 .
#Text=£1000 / week .
#Text=Plus a couple of self-catering cottages in Bunessan .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Take the short ferry crossing to Iona .
#Text=Reaching the rest of Mull is usually via Craignure , but there 's a lane along the coast via Dhiseig and Gruline to Salen .
